title: Immaterial
author: William Braxton
content:
When a platform is acquired—
to orate and surmise upon—
deities of heart arise.
The becoming of God comes as surprise.

One destroyed; one created.
An idol chosen to represent their Will.
Modes of interpretation captured for transmutation 
through the medium—
the King is nothing without their people.

Neither a God without worship.
To be sure, a pocket is created.
How do we decide to fill what's left
in the wake of exit?

Anemones devoid of roots to pull. 
Shepards with no sheep for wool.
Demigods without Gods to kill.

An engine rejects it's fuel in failure;
the mouth bites the hand in freedom.
The grin of falsehood becomes inevitable
Just as language's sin is at once indelible.

The voice of Subject
relies on Object.
The means of Object
relies on Subject.

How are Joy and Sorrow different?
"
